suggestion: The increase in number of passengers was especially visible in the North Atlantic and European routes
notes: Two distinct issues: if "especially" follows an adjective, the order of the adjective and adverb should be reversed. But if "especially" follows something other than an adjective, then a comma should be inserted before "especially".

suggestion: our customers are now booking holiday trips, especially for their autumn leave and for the upcoming winter season
notes: Two distinct issues: if "especially" follows an adjective, the order of the adjective and adverb should be reversed. But if "especially" follows something other than an adjective, then a comma should be inserted before "especially".

notes: Two distinct issues: if "especially" follows an adjective, the order of the adjective and adverb should be reversed. But if "especially" follows something other than an adjective, then a comma should be inserted before "especially".
